items.title: Aryna Sabalenka defeats Madison Keys in Australian Open final re-match at Brisbane International
items.summary: Aryna Sabalenka says she is no longer thinking about last year's Australian Open final loss to Madison Keys after defeating the US star at the Brisbane International.

items.title: Talc Alf's carved artworks attract tourists travelling the Strzelecki Track in outback SA
items.summary: Off the Strzelecki Track in outback South Australia lies the gallery of Talc Alf, so named for the artworks he carves out of soft, powdery talc.

items.title: Australia loses to Poland 2-1 in United Cup quarterfinals
items.summary: Alex de Minaur produces a signature tenacious display, but it is not enough to send Australia through to the United Cup semifinals in Sydney.

items.title: The King of Rock and Roll transcends language and culture at the Parkes Elvis Festival
items.summary: Japanese tribute artist Toki Toyokazu is part of a growing international presence at the annual Parkes Elvis Festival, which also includes women.

items.title: The daily struggle continues in Caracas as Venezuelans dare to hope for change
items.summary: The ABC hears from residents of Venezuela's capital, Caracas, about the struggles of daily life and their hopes and fears after American intervention.

items.title: NSW SES moves to embrace 'volunteers for a day' to boost members after May 2025 floods
items.summary: Experts say volunteering is not in decline, but it is becoming more spontaneous. The NSW disaster agency is moving to embrace this after seven women mobilised 1,200 people to volunteer for a day in record-breaking floods.

items.title: Barmy Army turns Ashes defeat into Australian tourism win
items.summary: The Barmy Army has continued the recent trend of UK travellers spending more time and money in Australia, despite a disappointing on-field performance from their side.

items.title: Cautious hopes Beijing lifting soft ban on South Korean pop culture
items.summary: China has restricted access to South Korean pop culture since 2016, when Seoul received US anti-missile technology. Warmer bilateral ties are spurring optimism that will change.

items.title: Elon Musk's AI bot says it is limiting its ability to 'undress' users. Australians want an opt-out
items.summary: For more than a week, X's AI bot Grok has been generating sexual images of women and children at the request of other users, even when they ask it not to.

items.title: Donald Trump is reshaping American power and the threat to international order is alarming
items.summary: There have been plenty of examples of the Trump administration's contempt for legalities, diplomacy and alliances, but this week Trump and his lieutenants went further.

items.title: Friday Finance with David Chau
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Accused scam kingpin Chen Zhi arrives in China after extradition from Cambodia
items.summary: Accused scam boss Chen Zhi is extradited to China from Cambodia after being indicted by the United States over an alleged multi-billion-dollar fraud.

items.title: RFS vision of Gobbagombalin fire in Wagga Wagga's north
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: ACT records first road fatality of 2026 after two-vehicle crash on Monaro Highway near Royalla
items.summary: A 25-year-old man has died after a crash between a car and a truck on the Monaro Highway, south of Canberra.

items.title: Ruffy residents describe devastation wrought by central Victoria's Longwood bushfire
items.summary: During winter the trees and hills surrounding the small hamlet of Ruffy are beautiful and green, but now it has been "decimated" by an out-of-control bushfire.

items.title: Family, friends pay tribute to Tasmanian man who died following alleged Hobart CBD altercation
items.summary: A 66-year-old Tasmanian man who died after an alleged altercation in Hobart's CBD on Tuesday night has been remembered by those who knew him.

items.title: Senior SA government officials reject claims of political interference into algal bloom causes
items.summary: Four of the most senior public servants working on South Australia's algal bloom have rejected allegations that departmental staff had been instructed not to investigate the cause of the ecological disaster until after March's state election.

items.title: Surge in heat-related illness as temperatures continue to soar across south-east
items.summary: Emergency departments, medical centres and first responders are dealing with a surge in heat-related illness across Australia's south-east as temperatures soar to near record levels.

items.title: Palestinian author seeks to be reinstated to Adelaide Writers' Week
items.summary: Palestinian author Randa Abdel-Fattah has called for her appearance at Adelaide Writers' Week to be reinstated after it was axed, but SA's Premier has continued to back the decision, as dozens of authors cancel their appearances.

items.title: Police urge drivers not to enter Queensland floodwaters and risk life
items.summary: Authorities hope fines will deter motorists from driving into flooded waters, after nearly half-a-dozen vehicles are stranded in two weeks.

items.title: Donald Trump pulls US out of dozens of international organisations on environment and security
items.summary: Protecting women and children, halting climate change and preventing acts of terrorism — these are the goals the White House now says go against America's goals.

items.title: Australia's population forecast to reach 28 million in 2026 despite fall in overseas migrants
items.summary: Australia's population is forecast to reach 28 million people in 2026 despite an easing of overseas arrivals following the post-COVID-19 migration peak.

items.title: The Bondi royal commission will be a long-term test of Albanese's leadership
items.summary: The prime minister's critics feel he failed to meet the moment in the immediate aftermath of the Bondi attack, but with the royal commission he has a chance to get it right.

items.title: Nick Kyrgios not seeking Australian Open wildcard, saying he is 'not quite ready' for grand slam
items.summary: Returning from injury, Nick Kyrgios has spoken with Australian Open organisers and made the call not to use a wildcard to play singles this year.

items.title: Diana Camacaro fled Venezuela when a friend close to Nicolás Maduro's regime texted her she was on a list to be arrested
items.summary: When a Telegram message landed on her phone, Diana knew she had to flee Venezuela. It was from someone close to Nicolás Maduro, and she says she would have been jailed, or worse.

items.title: Rio Tinto in merger talks with Glencore, takeover could create world's biggest miner
items.summary: Rio Tinto and Glencore are in takeover talks that could potentially lead to a combined mega-miner worth more than $US200 billion. Analysts are questioning whether Rio will be interested in Glencore's coal assets, having sold off its own in 2018.

items.title: Arsenal's Gabriel Martinelli apologises for 'disgraceful' act towards injured Liverpool player Conor Bradley
items.summary: Arsenal winger Gabriel Martinelli has apologised for shoving Liverpool's Conor Bradley, who was down with a serious knee injury, off the pitch during their Premier League clash.

items.title: NetBlocks reports internet blackout imposed in Iran amid nationwide protests
items.summary: Human rights groups say more than 40 people have been killed in protest-related violence since last month.

items.title: US border agent shoots and wounds two people in Portland, police say
items.summary: US Border Patrol agents were conducting a vehicle stop in Portland when the driver "weaponised" the vehicle before an officer "fired a defensive shot", according to the Department of Homeland Security.

items.title: How The Pitt lured ER star Noah Wyle back into the emergency department
items.summary: ER launched Noah Wyle's career in 1994. Thirty years later he's back in the emergency room — and scooping awards season — as Dr Robby in The Pitt.

items.title: Angela Jones's history-making ride from country upbringing to top of Queensland's jockey ranks
items.summary: Angela Jones became the number one jockey in Queensland in 2025. Now, the determined young woman, who grew up on a central Queensland cattle farm, wants Group 1 glory.

items.title: Man in anaphylactic shock on Virgin flight to WA's Pilbara saved by crew, another passenger
items.summary: Pilbara resident Andrew Rawle found himself 30,000 feet in the air, unable to breathe due to anaphylactic shock, but was saved by the crew and the selfless act of another passenger.

items.title: Inside Nicolás Maduro's complex network of alleged drug traffickers wanted by the US
items.summary: The deposed Venezuelan president allegedly oversaw a network of associates to facilitate the flow of illegal drugs into the US, aided by false passports, a guerilla training school, jets and grenade launchers.

items.title: Assault-accused MP Nick McBride says home detention makes him 'more wedded' to electorate
items.summary: South Australian MP Nick McBride, who has been charged with aggravated assault, says home detention will make him "more focused" on his electorate ahead of the SA election in March.

items.title: Community rushes to help victims of Appin crash that left 17-year-old dead
items.summary: The 17-year-old girl was killed and other passengers were seriously injured when a ute and sedan collided on a notorious road in Appin.

items.title: Top tips for learning a musical instrument or taking up singing at any age
items.summary: You can pick up an instrument or learn to sing at any age. Here are some helpful tips from experts and ABC Classic audience members to get you started.

items.title: NT pokies clubs report member perks, lavish upgrades as 'community' benefits
items.summary: Previously secret documents released under Freedom of Information laws have revealed how the Northern Territory's pokies clubs' community contributions are really being spent.

items.title: Dubbo woman Molly Croft raises $2 million after battling cancer twice
items.summary: This 19-year-old from western NSW, who has been diagnosed with cancer twice, is now helping others "find their rainbow".

items.title: Matildas and Arsenal star Kyra Cooney-Cross returns home in wake of mother's cancer diagnosis
items.summary: Arsenal's Australia international Kyra Cooney-Cross flies back to Australia to be with her mother, who has been diagnosed with stage 4 cancer.

items.title: RBA plays the long game on inflation, so an interest rate rise could still be some way off
items.summary: The Reserve Bank says inflation is "too high", but that doesn't mean it will necessarily rush to raise interest rates next month.

items.title: Maya Joint gets Ash Barty's backing with teenager's Australian Open milestone confirmed
items.summary: Teenage star Maya Joint will be the first home women's seed at the Australian Open since former world number one Ash Barty broke a 44-year title drought in 2022.

items.title: Locals, summer tourists swelter through heatwave in South Australia's Riverland
items.summary: South Australia's Riverland will swelter through yet another day in the mid-to-high 40s on Friday and will have to wait until the weekend for a reprieve.

items.title: Insect enthusiasts helping researchers keep an eye on bug populations
items.summary: Queensland insect enthusiasts are snapping photos of their backyard bugs to help researchers monitor native and invasive species.

items.title: US Senate votes to limit Trump's power to order strikes in Venezuela
items.summary: The vote in the Republican-controlled chamber still needs to pass the US House, and has virtually no chance of becoming law due to Donald Trump's presidential veto.

items.title: Solar to the fore as grid sails through heatwave and record demand
items.summary: For so long, the pounding sunshine of an Australian heatwave was the grid's biggest threat. It has now become its greatest asset.

items.title: How the internet reacted to the fifth Ashes Test at the SCG
items.summary: The internet went wild as Australia dominated with the bat, led by Travis Head and Steve Smith, and England crumbled in the dying embers of the Ashes.

items.title: Donald Trump's comments about Greenland were once seen as a joke. Greenlanders are no longer laughing
items.summary: The United States has a long history of wanting to acquire Greenland, but people living on the island say Donald Trump's latest comments about annexation feel different.

items.title: Antisemitism royal commission welcome, but some say it was called too late
items.summary: Community groups that lobbied for a national inquiry into antisemitism back the prime minister's announcement of a royal commission as the NSW premier pledges the NSW government's full cooperation.

items.title: JD Vance defends Minnesota shooting as self-defence amid immigration crackdown
items.summary: US Vice-President JD Vance says the shooting was justified and that 37-year-old mother-of-three Renee Nicole Good was a "victim of left-wing ideology".

items.title: Rinky Hijikata suffers three-set loss against Giovanni Mpetshi Perricard at Brisbane International
items.summary: Rinky Hijikata's three-set loss to big-serving Frenchman Giovanni Mpetshi Perricard means there are no Australians left in the Brisbane International singles.

items.title: England vice-captain Harry Brook apologises for incident at New Zealand nightclub ahead of Ashes
items.summary: Harry Brook was fined $60,000 and has apologised for bringing "embarrassment" to the English cricket team in a scuffle with a bouncer shortly before the Ashes.

items.title: Police arrest suspects after armed heist at airport believed to be Vanuatu's first organised robbery
items.summary: A brazen heist at Port Vila International Airport has stunned Vanuatu and become the talk of a nation unused to such overtly public acts of crime.

items.title: Victorian properties feared lost in out-of-control bushfire as heatwave persists
items.summary: Multiple properties are feared lost to an out-of-control bushfire in central Victoria, as Australia's first heatwave of the year continued to bring high temperatures across the country.

items.title: Men face court charged with manslaughter of 66-year-old who died after Hobart CBD altercation
items.summary: Two men face court after a 66-year-old man died from injuries police allege were sustained in an assault at a popular Hobart shopping strip.

items.title: What is a pyroCB, a fire-generated thunderstorm?
items.summary: The fire burning in north-east Victoria near Walwa was so fierce it generated its own weather this afternoon, including a substantial pyrocumulonimbus cloud with lightning and thunder.

items.title: No sightings of Kenneth John Giles 24 hours after shooting near Mullewa in WA's Midwest
items.summary: Police have issued a "personal plea" for Kenneth John Giles to turn himself in, almost 24 hours after a shooting in Mullewa.

items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: New research finds keeping room temperature at 24 degrees or below could reduce sleep stress for older Australians
items.summary: The study by Griffith University in Brisbane finds that a room temperature while sleeping of more than 24 degrees Celsius increases heart rate variability and physiological stress.

items.title: Ashes player ratings: England and Australia report card from 2025-26 Test series
items.summary: Here are the player ratings from a one-sided Ashes series with a few stand-outs and perhaps more flame-outs across the five Tests.

items.title: Who is Virginia Bell, the woman who will head the royal commission into antisemitism?
items.summary: Former High Court judge Virginia Bell will lead the inquiry into antisemitism. But who is the new commissioner?

items.title: Self defence or murder? What the videos of the Minnesota ICE shooting show us
items.summary: ICE agents shot a woman in Minnesota. The president says it was self-defence while protesters claim it was murder. Here's what the vision shows.

items.title: Three options the US is considering to take Greenland
items.summary: At least three options have been floated for Donald Trump to achieve his goal of taking Greenland for the United States.

items.title: Federal politics: PM announces antisemitism royal commission after Bondi terror attack — as it happened
items.summary: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has announced a royal commission into antisemitism after the Bondi Beach terrorist attack
